Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with row of lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: single narrow brown band; inscription on exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the interior decoration, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA96 and British Museum 1924,1201.591.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2032) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
